item.description:
GREEN MOUNTAIN WINTER SERIES:
The "Presidentials" of VT's Bread Loaf Wilderness

EVENT ORGANIZER:
Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran @ nycap.rr.com, Mobile 281-5882. Explore the wonderful Green Mountains of Vermont, coated white for winter! They are magical, and unforgettable.


A classic winter view in the Green Mountains ... hikers along the Long Trail.



IMPORTANT UPDATES (12/02/2009 1:30 PM) -- THE MEETUP DETAILS HAVE BEEN CLARIFIED:

1. We plan to reach the Green Mountain National Forest at the car spot location about 8 a.m., at "Natural Turnpike" at the intersection with Steam Mill Road, north of Ripton, VT. If you can meet us there that would be great -- we may need an extra car for spotting.

2. We'll then drive northward to South Lincoln, VT, at the end of Masterson Road and end of the Cooley Glen Trail, planning to meet there at 8:45 a.m. and hoping to start no later than 9:00 a.m.

3. Therefore, THE "CAR SPOT MEETUP TIME" IS ABOUT 8 A.M., AT THE NATURAL TURNPIKE / STEAM MILL ROAD CAR SPOT LOCATION, the southern end of this hike. THE "TRAILHEAD MEETUP TIME" IS ABOUT 8:45 A.M., AT THE COOLEY GLEN TRAILHEAD, THE END OF MASTERSON ROAD, SOUTH LINCOLN, VT LOCATION, the northern end of this hike.

4. We'll start hiking out towards Mount Grant via the Cooley Glen Trail; then hike southward along Vermont's famous Long Trail to the other Presidentials: Mount Cleveland, Mount Roosevelt and Mount Wilson. We''ll finish the range at the Bread Loaf Mountain and Battell Mountain summits, descending along the Skylight Pond side trail back to Kirby Road.

This is a cross-post with Albany NY-based Hiking Mates CHALLENGE. I've decided not to arrange lodging Schenectady Wintersports Club Lodge -- the group is unappreciative of hikers and while cheap, there are too many rules that make staying there stressful and unpleasant. Three of us are staying at Jay's house, southward near Springfield, VT. There are other options ... FYI, I am bringing my dog, Mike -- he's an extremely friendly Chocolate Lab -- he and I will be coming from the Whites after two hikes there.


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:

When / Where: See above.

Difficulty: About 12 miles, 3,760 Feet total vertical climb. At a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about an eight-hour hike. The last hour of this hike may be in darkness -- be sure to bring headlamps.

CLICK HERE: Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the meetup location to the car spot location at the intersection with Kirby Road, near Ripton, VT; then drive northward to South Lincoln, VT, at the end of Masterson Road and end of the Cooley Glen Trail, near South Lincoln, VT. In the winter the Natural Turnpike is closed at the trailhead, meaning that after the car spot we will have to backtrack through Bristol and East Middlebury to get to the trailhead.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; consider bringing charcoal warmers for fingers and toes.

NOTE: Poles and friction devices for boots, such as micro-spikes, "Yak-Traks" and / or crampons, are strongly recommended as added gear should wet rock surfaces freeze. Snow shoes may be required -- stay tuned for weather updates. CLICK HERE FOR CURRENT SNOW DEPTH INFORMATION FOR VERMONT.

Be sure to have a method for backpack attachment for these items; be sure to try out your gear before you start out for your first winter trip!


YOUR RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

Mt. Grant / Mt. Cleveland:
http://www.peakbagger...
http://www.mountainzo...
http://www.mountainzo...

Mt. Roosevelt:
http://www.peakbagger...
http://www.mountainzo...
A PHOTO TOUR

Mt. Wilson / Bread Loaf Mountain:
http://www.peakbagger...
http://www.peakbagger...
http://www.summitpost...
http://www.mountainzo...

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

CLICK HERE FOR A TOPO MAP / HIKE ROUTE -- PRINT AND TAKE A COPY WITH YOU.

See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my Green Honda Element
